story:
Thank you!

This campaign has ended. Many thanks to all those who supported Lighty, and even if we didn't reach our goal, rest assured that everyone who ordered a Lighty will receive a Lighty. 
Production will start this fall and we hope that by Christmas you'll all be enjoying room-wide movies in your homes. 
You'll soon be able to order Lighty at http://www.getlighty.com/buy.
Stay tuned with this project by subscribing here.
Meanwhile, take a look at what Lighty is about, below.

The New Lighty



This is the new Lighty. It has a 50 lumen HD projector, it's smaller than ever and appreciated by everyone at Bucharest Technology Week. 
Will update the specs in the following weeks.


  

  “Lighty opens up imagination on the possibility of future smart entertainment experience. “ Josh Liu, Managing Director at HardwarePro       

   "It can follow you anywhere and anytime, it can become indispensable. Lighty is not just a product, it's a story. With our help it will become a success story." Dan Calugareanu, CEO at Alliance Computers  

 
Lighty is world's first robotic HD laser projection system that blends the sweetness of a true movie-watching experience with the latest hi-tech candies invented. It is the next best thing to cinema - only that it fits in your pocket.




Ceiling Movies

 

Open-air gaming

 
The prototype of Lighty can play video through the projector for 5 continuous hours while on battery, or internet radio for about 10 hours. If plugged into its power supply,  you can just set it and forget it - the laser LED source is guaranteed for over 20,000 hours.
  


Internet radio

 
Apps like TuneIn  or Pandora unleash the beauty of online radio, as you can listen to stations from all around the world, in your kitchen, or on the deck, anywhere.  


Family entertainment


Wives and kids are usually hard to satisfy, but Lighty was made by using input from them! So whenever daylight doesn't let you actually watch full-wall movies, Lighty acts as an Internet radio, with over 8 hours of autonomy.


Office presentations


Lighty fits perfectly in any office - you can do business presentations on any wall, anywhere, without setting up laptops or projectors and power cables throughout the room. 
You will be able to pause the projection when doing behind-the-scenes work by just putting your hand in front of the projector, and resuming it the same way.  
  

Gadget Testing Platform

Lighty already supports interaction with gadgets like the Leap Motion controller. They can help you control the projector wirelessly, use gestures to manipulate presentations or movies and, why not, show off!

Lighty solves three big issues with projectors nowadays:

  • The lack of a good integrated sound system
  • To see a projector movie, you need a bag of cables: power cord, HDMI cable, speakers, laptop or tablet and let's not forget you need to be near a power outlet.
  • For ceiling projections, you need a good tripod, which makes for a not-very-mobile setup.

Lighty has none of these problems. Its integrated speakers are powerful enough to fill a mid-sized room with high-quality sound, and it doesn't need anything else to run than maybe your phone - everyone carries it around. 

Moreover, when you put your phone on Lighty's support, it charges wirelessly and mirrors the screen through WiFi, without needing a router.

But Lighty has more:

No other projector can rotate, tilt and park itself to save space and give you 360/90 degrees of freedom.

Because it uses a laser projector, Lighty doesn't need image focusing - the picture is just as crisp on any surface at any distance.

Lighty automatically levels the projected image when placed on uneven surfaces. If you don't like horizontal, there's a manual control for that, too.

You can turn it off without touching it - at all - it's equipped with a proximity sensor that senses when your hand is in front of it - and turns off projection.

Lighty knows the room it's in and remembers the last settings - through NFC patches.


   




Powerful pico projector

Lighty has an HD laser projector that can easily replace your TV or computer screen. The best part is that you can put up images on any surface, anytime, with unprecedented ease.



360º/90º Panoramic Movement

The projector in Lighty can tilt, rotate and park itself behind the screen, thus giving you the freedom to put your movie or TV show on any wall or surface! It also remembers the last couple of settings, and restores them the next time you want to watch something.



One Trackball

In an early iteration, the projector inside Lighty needed no less than 6 buttons to rotate, tilt, get in or out of its shell. Now, the only illuminated "ball" it has gives you natural and intuitive freedom of accessing even the most intricate of its functions.


Voice Recognition

This is how you can control the way Lighty moves, on which wall it puts the image, whether you want to turn it on or off, and many others, for times when you don't have your hands free.



Haptic Control (DoubleTap)

Just tap Lighty twice and it will come up, ready to charm you with a projection, on any wall, remembering its last position. Tap it twice again and it will go back to its (mobile) home.



Focus-Free

Because Lighty uses a laser projector, you don't have to touch a thing to focus the picture, when you move your projection from one place to another. Images will always be crisp and clear - instantly.



Automatic Leveling

If it's placed on an uneven surface, Lighty will self-adjust the horizontal image position, so you don't have to work hard to put stuff underneath it. This function can be manually overriden (in case you prefer a tilted image).


Silent on/off

Should your dear ones fall asleep during the movie (it happens to everyone), you can stop the projection without making any noise whatsoever. Simply, just put your hand in front of the projector and light stops flowing. If you do this with the projector already off, it'll turn the image on. What more can you want?

High-Quality Sound

Because tablets and pico-projectors don't usually have very good sound systems, we included nice-sounding speakers, so you can enjoy the most cinema-like experiences.



Wireless Connectivity

Lighty has Bluetooth and WiFi, for you to play music and movies straight from your phone or tablet. It can also be connected to already-existing Bluetooth speakers you may have around.



Lighty is very, very flexible in operation because it has Android at its core. 

You don't even have to be in the same building, town or country! Just stream your content and voice through the Internet and put Lighty on any wall you like, remotely. And you don't need expensive TVs or complex video conferencing systems for that. Lighty will do the job.


Timeline



Awards and Recognitions

 
So far, Lighty has won a 10,000 Euro grant from Innovation Norway, the "Advanced Track" award from Orange Innovation Labs and was highly appreciated by the visitors of the Startup Spotlight conference in November 2015. We've also attended the Vienna Maker Faire in April, and had more than 200 visitors at our booth admiring Lighty and the new laser projector.
 
 

Technical Specs

  • tablet with 8-core ARM CPU*
  • focus-free laser projector (real 50 ANSI lumens)
  • 1280x720 projection resolution (HD)
  • high-torque servo motors
  • infrared proximity sensor
  • accelerometer/gyroscope
  • USB
  • Wifi, Bluetooth, VGA Camera
  • 2x6W speakers
  • 5000 mAh battery
*tablet is optional, you can use your own and project via Wi-Fi or order one that's specially customized for Lighty.

Developing the prototype


It all started with this:

The contraption above is the first projector tilting mechanism. I used a servo motor, with the commands fed from an infrared remote control. You can call it "the first prototype." Later on, I ditched the infrared module in favor of wireless communications. If you'd like to see infrared come back on board, please shout.
 
One late night while working on the Lighty prototype.
Currently, the Lighty prototype is powered by a quad core processor. However, the final, commercial version will feature an octa-core ARM processor and video accelerator, enough to meet the demands of any movie watching freak.
 The projector in the Lighty prototype is now a modified (hacked) Samsung EAD-R10 with a 640x360 resolution, but the commercial version will contain a WiFi-enabled laser projector with a 720p resolution and 50 laser lumens.

The new look


Lighty's new look - this is the concept of the version backers will receive. The projector in the middle will tilt and the entire platform will rotate. The entire design is more solid and critical moving parts made from 2mm thick aluminum.


Lighty is green

Since it doesn't use much electricity to run and effectively replaces the TV (we ditched it at home), Lighty is the greenest piece of internet-connected, digital entertainment device you can have around.
One other reason for its eco-consciousness is that it uses far fewer materials than a TV ever will, no matter how "green" they say it is.
Where possible, we use 3D-printed parts made from corn (PLA), to lower our carbon footprint and make small-batch production possible. Huge factories are so yesterday! Bioplastics such as PLA (polylactic acid) are even stronger than regular, petroleum-based plastics.

Stretch Goals


$50,000

Will implement Leap Motion functionality in all Lighties sold. Which means you'll be able to do magic: you'll get Lighty out from its shell just by a dragging gesture in the air, and position the image by waving your hand above it, very precisely.
  

$100,000

Lighty will be able to work with the Myo armband, which is even more magic than the Leap Motion - it reads your muscles and guesses the hand movements and gestures.
  

$500,000

You'll be able to combine two or more Lighties to make proportionally-bigger images. They'll sync together automatically and you'll have huge-screen cinema really anywhere.


$1,000,000

Laser shows will be nothing out of the ordinary for Lighty. We have plans for a new model where more projectors join and create holograms and real daydreams... but can't say more about this. We need serious money to develop this. Support us.


The Team

Ovidiu Sandru - founder & hardware dev- Ovidiu has had a crush on electronics and programming since the age of 5. He left the corporate world of HP to work on his startup (and generally live life to the fullest). He now has a constant stream of ideas that he dreams to bring life to.



Adrian Serban - sound engineering - a music and electronics lover, Adrian has been an entrepreneur when few people really knew what tech entrepreneurship was.




Mike Sandru - graphic design - drawing his way to success, Mike's passion is to create visual art for various companies on his 27" Wacom tablet. His ideas are highly appreciated by thousands around the world. Maybe you've seen one of his works on some bus in London, these days.



Andreea Sandru - beta tester - a talented actress, but nevertheless with a crush on Lighty, and one of the founders of the idea that movies are better if watched on the ceiling.




Mary Sandru - crash testing and model - having crashed Lighty multiple times, Mary likes to watch cartoons and brag with it to her friends. She suggested at least one feature of Lighty (like the DoubleTap) and, despite her age, has discovered a few unobvious bugs. For that matter, Lighty protects itself by automatically retracting the projector very quickly in the case of a drop.


 
Ovidiu's other projects
Ovidiu is also the founder of The Green Optimistic (www.greenoptimistic.com), one of the oldest (2008) and most appreciated alternative energy websites on the web. He even interviewed Elon Musk, the CEO of Tesla Motors and SpaceX.
Lighty has been his most intense project so far. Having already invested thousands of dollars in it, he now wants to bring Lighty to mass production, so anyone can enjoy breaking free from the TV couch, watching the game outside on a wall with friends, playing with bluetooth-enabled devices or listening to internet radio anywhere. And even improvising karaokes in hot summer nights, in the backyard.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Why is Lighty more expensive than others? I've seen pico projectors at half this price on the market.
A: Lighty has an HD laser pico projector at its heart. What you may have seen are classic DLP projectors with less than 720p resolution, 10-20 real lumens and are not laser. Lighty has HD resolution, 50 lumens and its light source is a laser. The main advantage of laser projection is that you don't have to focus the image - it'll be as crisp anywhere you put it. Moreover, the projector in Lighty is moved by a small robot - it contains fine mechanics that need to be of the highest quality, to ensure many years of hard work. Add the extra convenience of putting the image anywhere without even touching it, and the newness of the device, the R&D needed to develop the product further here in Europe and... the price is not high at all.
Q: Why will you only ship in 2017?
A: We are a fresh company and don't like to make promises we can't keep. So if we told you we'll send you a Lighty two months from now or even next month, we'd be lying. That we're not going to do.
 


Risks and Challenges

As with all crowdfunded campaigns, your have to remember Indiegogo is not a store. So, in other words, by funding this campaign you're helping an idea come to true life. Your money shows that you believe in it, and are able to sacrifice a little of your hard-earned cash for seeing Lighty come alive.
There are risks inherent to any crowdfunded campaign, and we think each creator does his best to overcome them. These are usually associated with manufacturing, sourcing and the final cost of the product. We have sized the perks so that those risks are covered. 
To my best knowledge, Lighty has all the chances to reach the funders' hands, and I will still have money left for developing it further. That being said, this is a disclaimer: Lighty Electronics SRL-D will not be financially or legally responsible for any loss to funders in case something goes wrong. Funders invest at their own risk, and should do based on their own judgment. 
However, we would be deeply saddened if such things happened, and we'll put out honor, image and career at stake for them not to. We will do everything in our power with the money we will receive to make the marvelous experience of Lighty happen to everyone, not just to our families.

Disclaimer

The images you see in the video above and in the pictures are of Lighty's Alpha prototype. The actual design we're working on differs a bit from the prototype, but we strive for the functionality to remain the same or be improved in some areas. Unlike the Alpha, the version that backers will receive will have a much technically superior laser projector.
We're working hard to find the best and sturdiest design possible, in order to make a quality product and keep costs reasonable. We're also be going to sell Lighties to friends and acquaintances, so that is a question of honor.
story_txt:
Thank you!This campaign has ended. Many thanks to all those who supported Lighty, and even if we didn't reach our goal, rest assured that everyone who ordered a Lighty will receive a Lighty. 
Production will start this fall and we hope that by Christmas you'll all be enjoying room-wide movies in your homes. 
You'll soon be able to order Lighty at http://www.getlighty.com/buy.Stay tuned with this project by subscribing here.Meanwhile, take a look at what Lighty is about, below.
The New Lighty







This is the new Lighty. It has a 50 lumen HD projector, it's smaller than ever and appreciated by everyone at Bucharest Technology Week. Will update the specs in the following weeks.

  

 



“Lighty opens up imagination on the possibility of future smart entertainment experience. “
Josh Liu, Managing Director at HardwarePro


 

 

  

  

"It can follow you anywhere and anytime, it can become indispensable. Lighty is not just a product, it's a story. With our help it will become a success story."
Dan Calugareanu, CEO at Alliance Computers

 






 



Lighty is world's first robotic HD laser projection system that blends the sweetness of a true movie-watching experience with the latest hi-tech candies invented. It is the next best thing to cinema - only that it fits in your pocket.





Ceiling Movies




 
Open-air gaming


 

The prototype of Lighty can play video through the projector for 5 continuous hours while on battery, or internet radio for about 10 hours. If plugged into its power supply,  you can just set it and forget it - the laser LED source is guaranteed for over 20,000 hours.
  




Internet radio

 
Apps like TuneIn  or Pandora unleash the beauty of online radio, as you can listen to stations from all around the world, in your kitchen, or on the deck, anywhere.

 


Family entertainment




Wives and kids are usually hard to satisfy, but Lighty was made by using input from them! So whenever daylight doesn't let you actually watch full-wall movies, Lighty acts as an Internet radio, with over 8 hours of autonomy.


Office presentations








Lighty fits perfectly in any office - you can do business presentations on any wall, anywhere, without setting up laptops or projectors and power cables throughout the room. You will be able to pause the projection when doing behind-the-scenes work by just putting your hand in front of the projector, and resuming it the same way.

   Gadget Testing Platform


Lighty already supports interaction with gadgets like the Leap Motion controller. They can help you control the projector wirelessly, use gestures to manipulate presentations or movies and, why not, show off!



Lighty solves three big issues with projectors nowadays:


The lack of a good integrated sound system
To see a projector movie, you need a bag of cables: power cord, HDMI cable, speakers, laptop or tablet and let's not forget you need to be near a power outlet.
For ceiling projections, you need a good tripod, which makes for a not-very-mobile setup.

Lighty has none of these problems. Its integrated speakers are powerful enough to fill a mid-sized room with high-quality sound, and it doesn't need anything else to run than maybe your phone - everyone carries it around. 
Moreover, when you put your phone on Lighty's support, it charges wirelessly and mirrors the screen through WiFi, without needing a router.
But Lighty has more:

No other projector can rotate, tilt and park itself to save space and give you 360/90 degrees of freedom.
Because it uses a laser projector, Lighty doesn't need image focusing - the picture is just as crisp on any surface at any distance.
Lighty automatically levels the projected image when placed on uneven surfaces. If you don't like horizontal, there's a manual control for that, too.



You can turn it off without touching it - at all - it's equipped with a proximity sensor that senses when your hand is in front of it - and turns off projection.
Lighty knows the room it's in and remembers the last settings - through NFC patches.


   













Powerful pico projector
Lighty has an HD laser projector that can easily replace your TV or computer screen. The best part is that you can put up images on any surface, anytime, with unprecedented ease.





360º/90º Panoramic Movement
The projector in Lighty can tilt, rotate and park itself behind the screen, thus giving you the freedom to put your movie or TV show on any wall or surface! It also remembers the last couple of settings, and restores them the next time you want to watch something.



One Trackball
In an early iteration, the projector inside Lighty needed no less than 6 buttons to rotate, tilt, get in or out of its shell. Now, the only illuminated "ball" it has gives you natural and intuitive freedom of accessing even the most intricate of its functions.


Voice Recognition
This is how you can control the way Lighty moves, on which wall it puts the image, whether you want to turn it on or off, and many others, for times when you don't have your hands free.



Haptic Control (DoubleTap)
Just tap Lighty twice and it will come up, ready to charm you with a projection, on any wall, remembering its last position. Tap it twice again and it will go back to its (mobile) home.



Focus-Free
Because Lighty uses a laser projector, you don't have to touch a thing to focus the picture, when you move your projection from one place to another. Images will always be crisp and clear - instantly.



Automatic Leveling
If it's placed on an uneven surface, Lighty will self-adjust the horizontal image position, so you don't have to work hard to put stuff underneath it. This function can be manually overriden (in case you prefer a tilted image).


Silent on/off
Should your dear ones fall asleep during the movie (it happens to everyone), you can stop the projection without making any noise whatsoever. Simply, just put your hand in front of the projector and light stops flowing. If you do this with the projector already off, it'll turn the image on. What more can you want?



High-Quality Sound
Because tablets and pico-projectors don't usually have very good sound systems, we included nice-sounding speakers, so you can enjoy the most cinema-like experiences.





Wireless Connectivity
Lighty has Bluetooth and WiFi, for you to play music and movies straight from your phone or tablet. It can also be connected to already-existing Bluetooth speakers you may have around.




Lighty is very, very flexible in operation because it has Android at its core. 


You don't even have to be in the same building, town or country! Just stream your content and voice through the Internet and put Lighty on any wall you like, remotely. And you don't need expensive TVs or complex video conferencing systems for that. Lighty will do the job.




Timeline






Awards and Recognitions




 
So far, Lighty has won a 10,000 Euro grant from Innovation Norway, the "Advanced Track" award from Orange Innovation Labs and was highly appreciated by the visitors of the Startup Spotlight conference in November 2015. We've also attended the Vienna Maker Faire in April, and had more than 200 visitors at our booth admiring Lighty and the new laser projector.



 


 
Technical Specs

tablet with 8-core ARM CPU*
focus-free laser projector (real 50 ANSI lumens)
1280x720 projection resolution (HD)
high-torque servo motors
infrared proximity sensor
accelerometer/gyroscope
USB
Wifi, Bluetooth, VGA Camera
2x6W speakers
5000 mAh battery

*tablet is optional, you can use your own and project via Wi-Fi or order one that's specially customized for Lighty.


Developing the prototype



It all started with this:

The contraption above is the first projector tilting mechanism. I used a servo motor, with the commands fed from an infrared remote control. You can call it "the first prototype." Later on, I ditched the infrared module in favor of wireless communications. If you'd like to see infrared come back on board, please shout.

 


One late night while working on the Lighty prototype.

Currently, the Lighty prototype is powered by a quad core processor. However, the final, commercial version will feature an octa-core ARM processor and video accelerator, enough to meet the demands of any movie watching freak.

 The projector in the Lighty prototype is now a modified (hacked) Samsung EAD-R10 with a 640x360 resolution, but the commercial version will contain a WiFi-enabled laser projector with a 720p resolution and 50 laser lumens.


The new look
Lighty's new look - this is the concept of the version backers will receive. The projector in the middle will tilt and the entire platform will rotate. The entire design is more solid and critical moving parts made from 2mm thick aluminum.




Lighty is green



Since it doesn't use much electricity to run and effectively replaces the TV (we ditched it at home), Lighty is the greenest piece of internet-connected, digital entertainment device you can have around.


One other reason for its eco-consciousness is that it uses far fewer materials than a TV ever will, no matter how "green" they say it is.

Where possible, we use 3D-printed parts made from corn (PLA), to lower our carbon footprint and make small-batch production possible. Huge factories are so yesterday! Bioplastics such as PLA (polylactic acid) are even stronger than regular, petroleum-based plastics.





Stretch Goals

$50,000
Will implement Leap Motion functionality in all Lighties sold. Which means you'll be able to do magic: you'll get Lighty out from its shell just by a dragging gesture in the air, and position the image by waving your hand above it, very precisely.
  $100,000
Lighty will be able to work with the Myo armband, which is even more magic than the Leap Motion - it reads your muscles and guesses the hand movements and gestures.
  $500,000
You'll be able to combine two or more Lighties to make proportionally-bigger images. They'll sync together automatically and you'll have huge-screen cinema really anywhere.

$1,000,000
Laser shows will be nothing out of the ordinary for Lighty. We have plans for a new model where more projectors join and create holograms and real daydreams... but can't say more about this. We need serious money to develop this. Support us.

Mary Sandru - crash testing and model - having crashed Lighty multiple times, Mary likes to watch cartoons and brag with it to her friends. She suggested at least one feature of Lighty (like the DoubleTap) and, despite her age, has discovered a few unobvious bugs. For that matter, Lighty protects itself by automatically retracting the projector very quickly in the case of a drop.

He even interviewed Elon Musk, the CEO of Tesla Motors and SpaceX.Lighty has been his most intense project so far. story:
Tired of those usual headsets available in the market? Those same old boring designs? Well if you’re looking for a creative headphones you’re reading the right post. If you love guns and music here’s a good news for you.


BULLET BUDS

High Fidelity Cool Looking Handmade Headphones

We proudly present a new stylish and affordable solution in headphones, the BULLET BUDS.

Available in grey, black and white, the BULLET BUDS is the perfect fusion in style and audio technology.

The BULLET BUDS embodies strength, individuality, authenticity and style. 

HANDMADE - Each pair of Bullet Buds is unique, handmade by us.

GOOD SOUND - Bullet Buds headphones have the same live, crisp, full of details sound as the original headphones.

COOL LOOKING - They look like bullet casings and are made from bullet casings.

Built for Durability, Bold Iconic Design

Silicone Hollow Points, BULLET BUDS provide secure fit, tighter seal, increasing noise isolation and accentuated bass. Ensuring the BUDS stay securely in place in any situation.

Engineered by modifying the used cartridge from a 7.62mm bullet !

Created for music lovers, bullet buds can deliver a truly balanced and immersive listening experience. Each headphone is unique since we make them by hand in our workshop out of real bullet cartridge.


Original headphones specifications : 

Driver Unit: 2-Way Dynamic Driver

Impedance: 32ohms

Sensitivity: 104±2dB S.P.L. at 1KHz

Frequency Response: 20Hz-20,000Hz

Max. Input Power: 10mW

Cord Length: 1800±50mm

Plug Type: 3.5mm

Cord remote with Volume +/ - and ON/OFF Answer Button


Bullet Buds are great for everyone, especially for those who are into weapons. Surprise them with a unique gift.

Let me present you the modification process :

First it is polished to be shinier than it is brand new

Then we use a lathe machine to precisely cut the cartdrige to the exact dimensions

With a little adjustment to the inner diameter,  in the end we have the headphone casing.


Last step for the cartridge, using a different machine,  the cable hole is drilled.

The high fidelity low appealing design  headphones are disassembled and prepared to have their new housing.

The final product, as you will receive it - happy you !

story:
Short Summary

MyEnergo is service where you can rent out battery packs from a kiosk at any time of the day any where in your city. When you have a low or dead battery look for a MyEnergo kiosk, obtain a battery pack from the kiosk and recharge your device. Once the battery pack has fully charged your device, return the battery pack to the kiosk. Use MyEnergo services every time you’re in need of a recharge boost.

By helping out our campaign you can make these services available nationwide. Imagine MyEnergo kiosks in every airport, city and amusement park that you visit!


What We Need & What You Get

MyEnergo campaign is asking for forty thousand dollars. Once our goal has been reached the funds will be used to start the engineering process that will custom make kiosks needed to start MyEnergo. We will start with a minimum order of kiosks and launch the business in the city where the most votes are collected. If we were to collect more than the amount asked for, then we will also try to start business in the second city with the most votes.

You can vote for your city by contributing to our perks. The higher the perk the more votes you put in! The more votes in from your city the faster MyEnergo services will arrive at your home town, so do not forget to share this campaign on all your favorite social media sites. 

For any reason we do not reach our goal, any amount collected will be used for research of a simpler kiosk design which we would start in the city with the most votes.


The Impact

We greatly appreciate your contribution to our project and by helping to the cause you are eliminating the hassle of running out of battery in the times you need it most. No more plugging in to walls, no more looking for free outlets to plug into. No more preparing for trips with extra devices to carry along and no more buying expensive external batteries.

We all want MyEnergo to become a reality nationwide. Anywhere  any time and every time you need a battery boost we want to be there; at your schools, out in your city, traveling on the road, in every airport, and in every amusement park you visit! With your help we can make this a reality.


Risks & Challenges

Like any other project we face some challenges, first it would be reaching our goal on Indiegogo,  then the only challenge would be  establishing a headquarter in the city with the most votes. Lastly, what concerns us is deciding which manufacture would be the best choice to do business with in developing the kiosks.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not contribute to our campaign money wise, you can still help us out by sharing the link to campaign on all of your favorite social media sites!


More About MyEnergo

MyEnergo is a company that provides a monthly subscription service that will provide unlimited battery pack usage to it's member's. To all non-members our services are still available by paying a one time fee for the usage of the battery pack, but it must be returned in x amount of time so that the full price of the battery pack is not charged to the customers debit/credit card.

Imagine MyEnergo as a service similar to that of an ATM, there should be one close by every time you are in need of some fast cash. Same thing with MyEnergo, there should be a kiosk full of external battery packs ready to dispense at any time that you are in need of a recharge.
Thank you so much for taking the time to read our story and hope to be in your city soon.

story:
PRIDE Wireless

Communication is power. Imagine a global, mobile communications network, operated by the LGBTQ community, that has the power to rapidly effect incredible change and to make equality a reality. 

With the landmark United States Supreme Court's decision on June 26, it may look like we've done it;  Equality is here!

Well, MARRIAGE equality, in the USA is here, but while this ruling is an enormous leap forward for the global LGBTQ community, we may have won the "Love Battle" in the USA, but the "Equality War" rages on worldwide.

Consider this:

  • In 30 of the 50 United States, it is STILL LEGAL to fire or deny housing to LGBTQ citizens based on sexuality or gender identity.
  • STILL, 41% of transgender people have attempted suicide, compared with 1.6% of the general population - while 78% who had endured physical or sexual violence at school had attempted suicide.
  • Of the 1.6 million homeless American youth, STILL, UP TO 40% identify as LGBTQ.  
  • 26% of teens who came out to their parents are told to leave home. 
  • LGBTQ youth are STILL FOUR TIMES more likely to attempt suicide than their straight peers

  • With the Court's ruling, there are 18 countries who recognize same-sex marriage but there are STILL over 45 countries where expressing your love for a same-sex partner will result in imprisonment or even death.

Those who lost on the same-sex ruling have already started to shout back in the name of Religious Freedom.  So now is the time to continue the wave of momentum created by the same-sex marriage ruling and double down our efforts to finish the job of obtaining full equality!   

As Seen On


Now is the time to leverage technology to make equality a reality.  Now is the time for you to support and join PRIDE Wireless.

PRIDE is positioned to be the first LGBTQ majority owned and managed, global wireless company serving its own community. Through a philanthropic strategy of advocating for and significantly giving back to LGBTQ health, safety and equality, PRIDE's goal is to change the world, one cell phone at a time.

We believe that we have the power to rapidly effect incredible change and to make equality a reality for the LGBTQ community. By supporting our campaign, you and your family & friend's will enable us to fund our "COMING OUT" launch without requiring business investors.  This will give PRIDE the most freedom in how we advocate and determine the funds we return to the LGBTQ community. 

The business is seeking funding to  enable its launch during the 4th Quarter of 2015. 

The following are the major funding requirements to make this launch successful:

  • Initial Inventory, Packaging and Fulfillment - There will be the need to purchase our initial inventory of SIM cards, associated packaging design and fulfillment of non-device inventory which our Device partner would not cover. 
  • Federal Communication Commission (FCC) & State Public Utility Commissions (PUC's) Regulatory Compliance - Before PRIDE can offer wireless services, it has to first register with the Federal FCC and each State’s PUC.  This is a fairly straight forward process; however, the sheer number of States and associated filing and legal fees will be supported by this campaign.
  • Websites, Software Platforms and Billing Operations / Integration - Although most all required billing and operation systems are available through our network partners, PRIDE will have to integrate its Customer Self-Care portal and eCommerce engines to the back end systems.  
  • Marketing/Sales Conversions - PRIDE will initially perform various tests of its selling models through SEM/SEO campaigns.  Most of these test will take place through Facebook and Refer a Friend Programs. 


Finally, a cell phone company you'll be PROUD of... 

When you become a PRIDE customer, you will benefit from the same phones, networks, savings and Fabulous customer service you demand.  But the biggest benefit you receive is the satisfaction knowing that you've become philanthropic partners with your cell phone provider in order to advocate for, give back and help advance the health, safety and equality of the global LGBTQ community.

Each month, PRIDE donates a portion of its profits through monthly distributions as voted on by you - the PRIDE customer.  In each country that PRIDE operates, we will identify worthy health, safety and equality non-profits to support.  Causes will include:  LGBTQ healthcare (HIV/AIDS, breast cancer), suicide prevention, anti-bullying, homelessness, employment & housing and senior aging, 


PRIDE customers will benefit from the same phones and devices, and the same networks as the major providers - all at lower prices! PRIDE also offers a unique savings & deals club, all while providing the “Fabulous” customer service that the LGBTQ community appreciates and expects.  

Fast 4G/LTE Nationwide Network - With PRIDE, you get the excellent nationwide coverage you expect on one of America's largest 4G/LTE networks.



LGBTQ consumers are very much like everyday consumers - they like value and savings. PRIDE provides significant savings with its flexible, generous and unlimited service plans while customers save further by utilizing PRIDE Deals.

Flexible, Generous Plans for You & Your Family - PRIDE gives you the flexibility to choose the perfect pan for what you and your family need.  Choose from no contract, pre and post-paid unlimited talk, text and data plans.

Good Ol' Girl Network: Deals & Savings - PRIDE Deals is an exclusive savings club for PRIDE customers that offers great deals on travel, entertainment, restaurants and more.


Between higher disposable incomes, general wariness of potential discrimination or the perfect “designer gay gene,” LGBTQ consumers can be very demanding.  In all customer experience designs and in particular customer service, PRIDE will offer the excellence its customers demand.    

24/7 Support - There is nothing more frustrating that not being able to get help at anytime of the day or week when stuck with a problem.  Whenever you need assistance, our knowledgeable Customer Service operators are here for you 24 hours a day, seven days a week.

Service in Your Local Language - At PRIDE, we don't believe your product challenges or issues should be lost in translation.  We will provide Customer Service agents who are local to your country and speak your language - the way you speak.

Problems Can be Fun - LGBTQ consumers understand how to lighten things up and have some fun - or be gay!  PRIDE Wireless Customer Service operators are not only knowledgeable to help answer your questions but will have a little fun with you along the way.


What We Need & What You Get

It's believed that PRIDE, depending on how well we execute over the next five years, can reach between $230M and $2.4B in annual revenue while advocating and giving back between $2.5M and $32M per year.

Since incorporating, we've secured a strategic partnership that grants us cellular network access in 32 countries.  We've registered the “PRIDE” brand with the US Patent Office, established all the critical relationships to launch a cellphone company, and have done the planning, analysis & marketing work required to sell, ship and support our first customers. 

We’ve done all of this through self-funding and are seeking additional capital to get us through this next phase. The good news is we’ve received some outside investments already and are experiencing strong interest by business investors; however, we'd like to keep things in the "Family" and are asking for your help in raising an additional $50,000 USD  so that we can launch within 90 days.

Of course for your support, there are attractive perks.  Perks include early access to our products and services; however, you will benefit the most from the great value and service PRIDE provides but more so, you will be partnering with PRIDE to make the LGBTQ world a better place for generations to come.



Challenges & Opportunities

We are a team of very experienced individuals who have gone through the mobile device product development and go to market process more than once. Unforeseen things sometimes happen, but we are convinced that we can begin to sell, ship and support customers within 90 - 120days of completing this campaign (October/ November 2015).  We'd like to be OUT in full force at Atlanta Pride - October 10-11th.  

The biggest risk eliminators are our initial inventory order of SIM cards, completing our registration with individual state Public Utility Commissions (PUCs), and final billing system software integration and deployment.  This is why we need funding of more than $50.000. Every additional cent makes it safer.  We continue to look for raise to reduce these costs or establish other means to pay for these expenses in order to reduce the risk of our launch.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, it doesn't mean you can't help! Please help us spread the word!   

Start by clicking on the social media sites below then like us, follow us, or join our social media sites so we can keep you abreast of our developments and share with your family and friends.

  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • LinkedIN
  • Instagram
  • Google Plus
  • YouTube

We're not asking you to switch teams; just cell phone carriers.
story_txt:
PRIDE Wireless


Communication is power. Imagine a global, mobile communications network, operated by the LGBTQ community, that has the power to rapidly effect incredible change and to make equality a reality. 
With the landmark United States Supreme Court's decision on June 26, it may look like we've done it;  Equality is here!


Well, MARRIAGE equality, in the USA is here, but while this ruling is an enormous leap forward for the global LGBTQ community, we may have won the "Love Battle" in the USA, but the "Equality War" rages on worldwide.
Consider this:



In 30 of the 50 United States, it is STILL LEGAL to fire or deny housing to LGBTQ citizens based on sexuality or gender identity.

STILL, 41% of transgender people have attempted suicide, compared with 1.6% of the general population - while 78% who had endured physical or sexual violence at school had attempted suicide.
Of the 1.6 million homeless American youth, STILL, UP TO 40% identify as LGBTQ.  
26% of teens who came out to their parents are told to leave home. 
LGBTQ youth are STILL FOUR TIMES more likely to attempt suicide than their straight peers
With the Court's ruling, there are 18 countries who recognize same-sex marriage but there are STILL over 45 countries where expressing your love for a same-sex partner will result in imprisonment or even death.

Those who lost on the same-sex ruling have already started to shout back in the name of Religious Freedom.  So now is the time to continue the wave of momentum created by the same-sex marriage ruling and double down our efforts to finish the job of obtaining full equality!

story:
The app

TradingLog is an advanced easy-to-use yet powerful trading journal for traders and investors. Whether a trader is daytrading, swing-trading, or position trading, he/she will fall in love with this tool. It supports stocks, futures, currencies (forex), etc. and it's available for iOS and Android users.

Being successful at trading requires to sustain a delicate balance between METHODOLOGY, PSYCHOLOGY, and MONEY MANAGEMENT.

Our app solves the MONEY MANAGEMENT aspect of trading. All the stats needed to conduct a profitable trading are now in one place: PnL, accuracy, risk/reward ratio, average time in market, sharpe ratio, cumulative balance, account variation, comprehensive charts and many more.

Nowadays, the increasing number of people doing home-based trading doesn't have a good piece of software to keep their numbers in place other than a spreadsheet.

That's where our project comes in.


Ourselves

We are two passionate software developers who decided to team up and create TradingLog, a mobile app designed to keep track of a stock trader's activities and ease money management by calculating his/her stats.

We are also very passionate about economy and the capital markets in general. When studying them we learned that money management principles is the only "holy grail" for retail stock traders to make money and how important it is for them to do it accurately.


What we need

In order to achieve the kind of discovery that we need to meet our goals, we are requesting funds to promote our app and reach our potential customers world-wide.

All the funds we receive will go to build online ad campaigns looking to increase traffic to our website (this will happen even if we don't reach the desired budget), produce a short video ad with voice actors to teach how the app works, pay for ads within trading channels and forums, and hire an SEO / community management service.

At $1,000 we'll launch our first Google AdWords campaign.

At $2,000 we'll produce a video ad that will be published on YouTube.

At $3,000 we'll hire an SEO / community manager service.

Above $3,000 we'll launch additional Google AdWords and Facebook campaigns, looking to reach more traders around the world and investing all we receive in these advertising vehicles.


What we offer

Since ours is a paid app, we'll be donating to charity the same amount of money that we receive, one dollar at a time for each app that we sell through the marketing efforts that we'll be conducting.

Also, since we are software developers, we offer to assist you with any project you might be working on. Here's our LinkedIn profiles so you can see our skills:

  • Luciano Ropero
  • Francisco Facal

We also have a 1 on 1 trading course that could serve as a very solid starting point if you're willing to learn this craft (it's valuable even if you have some trading experience since we'll teach you how to read supply & demand from a chart using Volume Spread Analysis).

Make sure you check out our other perks as well :)


Other ways you can help us

Follow us on Twitter and spread the word by sharing our campaign through the social buttons at the top left of this page. Also, if you happen to know any traders kindly show our tool to them.

Thank you!

story:
My names Oswald Poyser 

I'm 25 from Toronto,ON Canada.  I studied IT at a private institution was ready and willing to work in my field until I was told I didn't have any work experience and was unable to hire.  My first job was assisting my father who is an electronic technician.  I was then inspired to attend school and program the networks we had implemented for telecommunication companies.  When I finished school and lacked experience, I then decided to join an agency which placed me in a warehouse I worked at for 2 years. I did more studying, got my sales license (OMVIC) sold/marketed cars, customer service for a financial institution, paved driveways, high rise construction.  I now generate leads for business professionals. My passion is writing and I'm addicted to information.


This project was inspired back in 2012 the domain name was purchased but I never got around to development because of the magnitude of the project.  After looking at what it would cost to build, market, and launch I got discouraged and slept on myself until October 2014 when a former Microsoft employee launched an app inspired for the same reason I came up with this one. I've always wanted to offer something to the world whether it was a service, advice, literature, cinema, a product, or motivation.  

Any contribution isn't just a confirmation of what I would like to accomplish, but an understanding of who I am, where I'm coming from the fear of failure, and the desire to succeed.  You can force feed your brain with information, but not everything will remain my inexperience for employers motivated me to have a versatile resume in different areas.

I'm Going to need $225,000 to develop, market, and advertise this app.   The few firms I'm in talks with said they start at $50,000 , but when I get into the details of I've been quoted as high as $500,000 that's when I knew that my app wasn't going to be ordinary.  

I'll be giving out thank you's, Video shout outs, Pen's, PDF of my book of quotes, Soft Cover of the story of my life, one on one phone call or skype video to know even more about myself and want my goals are for myself and the world.

If I don't reach my goal I'll be publishing a few novels and continue to write and push my business to the next level.  If my business continues to grow I'll eventually be able to create this app and many other things for mankind.

Were all capable beings who probably haven't tapped into our inner selves,  anything is possible and when you stop having doubt all you can do is prosper.

The value of this app will change the direction were headed in ways of communication, also stop distracted driving (hands free).  Will change the way  news gets to us, will give the average person without a lane or credentials a voice could be as small as an opinion or joke.  We can stop looking at each others lives and hear each other again.

This won't be my last application or contribution to society I'm just in a very good space and feel now is the time.

"I use to wan't a million dollars, now I just want to change the world"
                                                       Oswald Poyser


Thanks

story:
On August 9th 2014, around 7 pm, Sarah, my life partner, best friend, confidante and wife, had a heart attack (her main heart arteries suddenly blocked), which then induced a cardiac arrest (her heart stopped!) from ventricular fibrillation (that is, the heart’s electrical signals stopped).

At the time, we were lying in bed, watching TV at the foot of the bed, and both pottering (I should have been studying for an Operations Management exam) and reading on our iPads. I was debating with myself about whether to go downstairs and clean up the garage versus continuing to ’bludge’ in bed.

I then heard her make a clucking sound, like our chickens in Fiji used to do, so didn't take notice straight away, as I thought she was ‘bunging’ it on at first, to be humorous.

Then her head fell to the side with her tongue slightly hanging outside her mouth, almost like you see when kids fake being shot and dying.

I then started to panic, and ran around the bed to try and understand what was going on – as Sarah has type 1 diabetes, I at first thought maybe it was hypoglycaemic shock, and was frantically thinking about whether I could find the Glucogon pen, or Epi Pen, and whether I would be able to ‘stab it in’?

So I checked to see if she was dripping sweat, and she wasn't, so now I knew this wasn't related to her blood sugars, as when she is typically ‘low’.

Her clucking sounds were coming every now and then, and this later I was to discover was Sarah trying to breathe.

I now went into a complete Funk – Freeze, Flight and Fight. First I wanted to scream and have somebody come save me – but there was no one, as we live in a very quiet apartment block. I started blubbering like a little girl, and ran up and down on the same spot as if trying to run away.

It should be appreciated that my understandable ‘freaking out’ was surprising, considering my many (30+) years of managing and dealing with sensory overload from so called risky sports of hang gliding, motorbike racing and skydiving.

I snapped out of it when I realised I needed to put some pants on – my family, very much later laughed at this (I wasn't known as the naked gardner in Fiji for nothing) – but this physical, practical, unrelated to the emergency action, made me start to react proactively.

So, I raced back around the bed to hunt for my phone, which had fallen behind the bed earlier that afternoon, lamenting iPhone pass codes, and called 000 emergency. (Maybe a voice override recognition emergency option would be a good idea?)

I got straight through, and the calm reassuring emergency responder person, began me on my way to getting Sarah from the bed to the carpet.

This proved challenging, as anyone who has tried to move a prone body will know. She had part fallen between the bedside drawers and bed, so was becoming wedged, and suspended mid air as the bedside drawer moved to jam the bedroom door on the cat play stand against the wall – an unbelievable nightmare!

With extreme adrenaline supported effort, I managed to get the non breathing Sarah on the floor.

So here I was blubbering like a stuck pig, phone in one hand to ear, and beginning a lame one handed CPR on Sarah. The operator did not want to let me put the phone down, I guess in case she lost me. But I put it down, hit the speaker, and then began some serious two handed CPR, hoping like hell it was in the optimum location.

Lots of people say it should be to the beat of the BeeGees ‘Staying Alive’, but I can tell you, all I did was do it as fast as I could, which was about 2 compresses every second. There were no dam tunes going through my mind, BeeGees or otherwise.

I lost all sense of time, and even now couldn't tell you how long it took me to begin CPR – in the days that followed, by visualising what I remember doing, I estimate it was 2 minutes, but it could have been 30 seconds or 30 minutes. I will never know!

From my phone call, to the paramedics arriving was documented as 6 minutes – remarkable, fantastic, fortunate coincidence, as the wonderful NSW Paramedics happened to be very close by. Usually it is around 11 minutes, but of course can be up to 30 minutes in extreme cases in traffic, excess  demand etc.

They were followed closely by the volunteer Hatzolah Paramedics that primarily attended cardiac arrest cases – one of only two suburbs in Sydney which have this valuable, dedicated service, sponsored by the generous Jewish community.

They took over from me, a sweaty, blubbering mess.

They administered an Automated External Defibrillator (AED) shock, but as it was now 8 or 9 minutes, they had to continue CPR for another 25 minutes, and I like to think that my sorry traumatised condition spurred them on for longer than they normally might have. (An AED needs to be administered within the first 5 minutes, as after this time it becomes increasingly less likely to revive someone.)

They eventually, miraculously brought her back, and after some time got her stable and started the Herculean task of getting her down three flights of stairs unconscious in a stretcher.

The seven paramedics were great, constantly reassuring me, and I didn't notice at the time, but Sarah’s mum observed them giving high fives in the street, whilst Sarah and I were loaded up into two separate ‘ambo’s’ (ambulances).

It turns out that they had been unable to revive and save the previous 28 cardiac arrest victims. Cardiac arrest is a ‘mongrel’ (horrible human tragedy!) It strikes instantly, often without warning,  and is almost certainly fatal, particularly if no early intervention, within seconds - not minutes or hours.

Sarah’s miracle continued. So far, the stars had aligned, with me coming to my senses and calling emergency services, then performing CPR (not sure how effective it was), emergency services answering immediately (on a Saturday night!), the paramedics life saving rapid response, and then having world class on call, ready to go, cardiac surgeons at St Vincents hospital – one of only two teams ready at separate Sydney hospitals available for unscheduled cardiac surgery emergency. (A young man in his late twenties had a cardiac arrest at the same time, and was sent to the other hospital, Royal Prince of Wales – he died on the surgery table).

She received two stents in her primary heart artery, and spent the next 14 days in intensive care in a coma. The attending doctors were not sure how much brain injury she had sustained, and I was petrified that her personality, and her ‘brain the size of a planet’ might be compromised. Many of her friends (very much later), joked that if she lost half her brains, she still would be smarter than most people.

When Sarah ‘woke’ up from her coma, although she had by this stage had her ventilator tube replaced by a tracheotomy, (so she still couldn't talk), she lit up when I walked into the ICU. (After Day four, a particular Doctor I nicknamed Dr. Doom, continually suggested that as each day passed, we were increasingly likely to get a zucchini back, and not our Sarah.)




I knew she was back, albeit with her side trek to hell, and the joy I felt at her recognising me, and with an intelligent look in her eye, was indescribable.

She now had to learn to eat, swallow, cough up fluid, and then walk, over next 25 days.

Whilst Sarah was in hospital, I was learning a lot about patient care, drugs and how woefully unprepared I had been about cardiac arrests and heart attacks.

Due to the horror of dealing with what happened to Sarah, we are committed to making this dream a reality, because in the years ahead, I would hate to see this level of cardiac arrest death, trauma and subsequent human misery for other people in the world, when there is the technological means to alleviated his human tragedy.


What I learned really shocked me.

Cardiac arrest or sudden cardiac arrest (SCA), (Out of Hospital), is the number one biggest killer in the world at around 6 to 7 million deaths p.a. Bigger than malaria which is around 3 million p.a. Total heart disease related deaths (stroke and heart attacks etc) account for a staggering 26 million people p.a.!!! 1000 people per day die from SCA in the USA, and 30 000 people p.a. in Australia. It is estimated to cost $380 Billion p.a. within the hospital system in the USA?!

So, I started to try and work out a solution as to how to approach this problem. My first approach was to consider employing first responders on much lower cost scooters equipped with AED’s, special bike helmets with voice GPS all under the existing paramedic services infrastructure umbrella.

The idea being that these responders would be volunteers, with a minimum of training (that is, knowing CPR and how to use the AED’s), and located in suburbia in far greater numbers than centrally located Ambulance services, only responding to cardiac emergencies, and aiming to get there in under 5 minutes.

To my mind, the scooter concept was a great idea, which I reluctantly had to let go. Sarah, initially said it was a great idea (for encouragement purposes I suspect), but kept pointing out the ‘bleeding’ obvious – the logistics of achieving this in Sydney, let alone around the world, would be nigh on impossible!

I read up on Samaritan Sam in London, essentially an APP illustrating where the nearest AED’s were, and although they had tremendous life saving results in a large densely populated city, this couldn't be effective in regional sparsely populated communities.

Airlines have achieved a 70% survival rate with many AED’s in close proximity, and Las Vegas Casinos at 80%. Seattle, in the USA achieves around 56% survival rate, as it is mandatory for every vehicle license holder to be certified in CPR. (Interestingly, I saw a map of Singapore University where they had placed literally hundreds of AED’s all over campus. This must have cost over a $1M and demonstrates their understanding of the life saving value in AED’s!)

So the take away from this is that readily accessible AED’s, and early CPR intervention, achieves a greater than 50% survival rate from a world wide current average survival rate of 1%, USA at around average 5%, and Australia around average 3%.

Begrudgingly, I looked more closely at the AED, to see why it was so expensive, and thus not widely available.

Through my various readings and research, it was suggested that expense was due to the very large battery necessary to retain charge for up to 4 years, high quality assurance to ensure functionality when it was needed over this time frame, and of course the relatively low volumes to support true scales of economy.



                          



These three key determinations allowed me to keep researching ways of achieving solutions. A break through then followed, when I realized that implantable defibrillators were so much smaller (the size of 3 large 50 cent coins stacked upon each other ~ roughly speaking), with the bulk of their mass again donated to a 10 year battery, and the ‘voltage delivery and sensors taking up the space of half a cigarette in size.

These devices are enormously costly, again due to smaller volumes manufactured, very expensive due to surgically appropriate materials (like gold for circuits), huge R & D to be amortized, and costly medical regulatory compliance costs.

The exact realization of getting a small device such as this implantable defibrillator into a smart phone was not a linear process, but made perfect sense! Many discussions with Sarah and my partner in this endeavor, Andre, allowed a true brainstorming discovery process.

With 2016 projected sales of two billion smart phones world wide, it must be the most coveted, ubiquitous prized possession of everyone, from young kids to the elderly.

This takes care of the volume consideration and economies of scale that could reduce the manufacturing cost.

The technology thus exists to reduce the size of the AED, by having the delivery of the required voltage in the size of cigarette sized cylinder, which could then be placed in the bottom of the phone case.

The sensing components (pads) would be specially designed fold out and expandable from the back of the case – very thin, and wires concertinaed.

The voice and visual display would be downloadable in APP form, with speaker already in the smart phone.

No requirement for a battery, which would utilize the iPhone (and potentially other devices like the iPad) built in battery, which is kept small by regular over night charging.

With AED mode utilization, the battery charge would be used completely over a 30 minute to 40 minute AED mode working period.

Lower quality standard requirements for components that remain outside the body, and which typically, only need to last a year, two at the most as compared with an AED.

Initially, it is felt that the phone case is the preferred location of the AED, as once it is used, a new one would be required. If it were placed in the iPhone itself, costs may go up, and servicing cost would be enormous. Discussions with Smart phone manufacturers like Apple and Samsung are planned however in the future.




The power of this idea, is that the affordability, and thus availability by virtually everyone, if the cost of the CELLAED is around the same cost of a current phone case!

(And with the planned, simply beautiful, futuristic range of materials and designs of phone cases to come, it will be easy to see universal adoption.)

To ensure this affordability and widespread use, we have structured this enterprise as a Not for Profit Association – so profits are retained to continue the development of this social enterprise, and not be distributed to a few share holders, thereby benefiting everyone in the world.

With a successful future global business, we are aiming to then fund research into heart disease and see if we can identify causality and treatments to this horrific malady. We will also look at methods for ensuring the rest of humanity has the option to access this life saving technology by subsidizing smart phones in many countries that most people cannot afford, are among the many other solutions we are discussing.

Losing Sarah would have been unimaginable for me, so too is the loss of millions of other lives, and the misery attached seems unacceptable to me. Sarah had two days prior to the cardiac arrest, just ‘hit the send button’ on her ‘Draft Code of Practice for Autologous Stem Cell Therapies in Australia’– so the loss would not only have been to me, family and friends, but the medical scientific community.

It is for this reason we haven't spent the time to lodge patents. Many years could be lost in this process, and since we are not solely motivated by profit, we are placing this in the public domain for endorsement and support. Support via the perks, pledges or volunteering help is very welcome.





In simple terms, the CELLAED works as follows:

The CELLAED will go into AED mode as soon as the two pads are pulled out from the back of the phone case – immediately then the relevant country emergency service is subsequently dialed.

As the pads are placed on the victim, the emergency operator is obtaining location details (although they may have this information from the location APP already).

The CELLAED then advises both on the screen and in loud audio to either keep hands free as a shock is administered, or it advises to commence CPR and can advise how to do this.

The AED assistance is found to be calming and provides for a heuristic response, thereby alleviating some of the responder trauma anxiety. The CELLAED will enhance these characteristics through superior audio and visual cues.





Along this journey, my friend Andre Serobian and I studied our MBA’s together at MGSM last year, where we developed a synergistic exchange of ideas and constant ‘storming’. Andre has a Bachelor in Medical Science and a PhD in Pharmacology from UNSW Australia Faculty of Medicine and has in addition, formed a close working relationship with my sister Dr. Mavourneen Casey who teaches in the Faculty of Medicine at the University of Queensland.

We have a fine team, and my undergraduate years in Engineering and Science at the University of Sydney have given me access to many of my engineering friends, some of whom manage large Electrical Engineering based companies.

We are very excited by this future product and its benefit to everyone, everywhere, all over the World. We have the idea, we have the technology, we have the skilled people who care – we invite you to join us on our journey to make this dream a reality.


CELLAEDTM - Get ready for it…





We are a registered non-profit organisation

Heart Start Rapid Response Revival Incorporated 

- INC15000469 -



Why Indiegogo?

Many other crowd-funding sites won't allow products that are in conceptual development stage which use photos that are rendered to demonstrate a future possible look. Using a crowd-funding platform allows us to enter the market quickly with a viable product and get feedback from early adopters so we can further refine the product. 

Use of Funds

We’re seeking funds to help Rapid Response Revival's CELLAED take the next steps. The only thing that is holding us back is funding.

Please help us make CELLAED a global reality and make a radical difference in global cardiac arrest deaths.

Shipping and Delivery

Every reward includes FREE SHIPPING with tracking.

Risks and Challenges

While there are risks inherent in any new project, our team has the skill and experience to guarantee we will keep working on this product until it becomes a reality.Despite inevitable mis-steps and potential delays, we have the right product at the right time and can't do it alone. IndieGoGo is our best option for kick-starting this business in a world that is increasingly dominated by big business and big money.

Questions?

If you have any questions or concerns, please shoot us an email at indiegogo@rapidresponserevival.org and we will answer as soon as possible!
story_txt:
On August 9th 2014, around 7 pm, Sarah, my life
partner, best friend, confidante and wife, had a heart attack (her main heart arteries
suddenly blocked), which then induced a cardiac arrest (her heart stopped!)
from ventricular fibrillation (that is, the heart’s electrical signals
stopped).
At the time, we were lying in bed, watching TV at the foot
of the bed, and both pottering (I should have been studying for an Operations
Management exam) and reading on our iPads. I was debating with myself about
whether to go downstairs and clean up the garage versus continuing to ’bludge’
in bed.
I then heard her make a clucking sound, like our chickens in
Fiji used to do, so didn't take notice straight away, as I thought she was
‘bunging’ it on at first, to be humorous.
Then her head fell to the side with her tongue slightly
hanging outside her mouth, almost like you see when kids fake being shot and
dying.
I then started to panic, and ran around the bed to try and
understand what was going on – as Sarah has type 1 diabetes, I at first thought
maybe it was hypoglycaemic shock, and was frantically thinking about whether I
could find the Glucogon pen, or Epi Pen, and whether I would be able to ‘stab
it in’?
So I checked to see if she was dripping sweat, and she
wasn't, so now I knew this wasn't related to her blood sugars, as when she is typically
‘low’.
Her clucking sounds were coming every now and then, and this
later I was to discover was Sarah trying to breathe.
I now went into a complete Funk – Freeze, Flight and Fight.
First I wanted to scream and have somebody come save me – but there was no one,
as we live in a very quiet apartment block. I started blubbering like a little
girl, and ran up and down on the same spot as if trying to run away.
It should be appreciated that my understandable ‘freaking
out’ was surprising, considering my many (30+) years of managing and dealing
with sensory overload from so called risky sports of hang gliding, motorbike
racing and skydiving.
I snapped out of it when I realised I needed to put some
pants on – my family, very much later laughed at this (I wasn't known as the
naked gardner in Fiji for nothing) – but this physical, practical, unrelated to
the emergency action, made me start to react proactively.
So, I raced back around the bed to hunt for my phone, which
had fallen behind the bed earlier that afternoon, lamenting iPhone pass codes,
and called 000 emergency. (Maybe a voice override recognition emergency option
would be a good idea?)
I got straight through, and the calm reassuring emergency
responder person, began me on my way to getting Sarah from the bed to the
carpet. 
This proved challenging, as anyone who has tried to move a
prone body will know. She had part fallen between the bedside drawers and bed,
so was becoming wedged, and suspended mid air as the bedside drawer moved to
jam the bedroom door on the cat play stand against the wall – an unbelievable nightmare!
With extreme adrenaline supported effort, I managed to get
the non breathing Sarah on the floor.
So here I was blubbering like a stuck pig, phone in one hand
to ear, and beginning a lame one handed CPR on Sarah. The operator did not want
to let me put the phone down, I guess in case she lost me. But I put it down,
hit the speaker, and then began some serious two handed CPR, hoping like hell
it was in the optimum location. 
Lots of people say it should be to the beat of the BeeGees
‘Staying Alive’, but I can tell you, all I did was do it as fast as I could,
which was about 2 compresses every second. There were no dam tunes going
through my mind, BeeGees or otherwise.
I lost all sense of time, and even now couldn't tell you how
long it took me to begin CPR – in the days that followed, by visualising what I
remember doing, I estimate it was 2 minutes, but it could have been 30 seconds
or 30 minutes. I will never know!
From my phone call, to the paramedics arriving was
documented as 6 minutes – remarkable, fantastic, fortunate coincidence, as the
wonderful NSW Paramedics happened to be very close by. Usually it is around 11
minutes, but of course can be up to 30 minutes in extreme cases in traffic,
excess  demand etc.
They were followed closely by the volunteer Hatzolah
Paramedics that primarily attended cardiac arrest cases – one of only two
suburbs in Sydney which have this valuable, dedicated service, sponsored by the
generous Jewish community. 
They took over from me, a sweaty, blubbering mess.
They administered an Automated External Defibrillator (AED) shock, but as it was
now 8 or 9 minutes, they had to continue CPR for another 25 minutes, and I like
to think that my sorry traumatised condition spurred them on for longer than
they normally might have. (An AED needs to be administered within the first 5
minutes, as after this time it becomes increasingly less likely to revive
someone.)
They eventually, miraculously brought her back, and after
some time got her stable and started the Herculean task of getting her down
three flights of stairs unconscious in a stretcher.
The seven paramedics were great, constantly reassuring me,
and I didn't notice at the time, but Sarah’s mum observed them giving high
fives in the street, whilst Sarah and I were loaded up into two separate ‘ambo’s’ (ambulances).

emergency services answering immediately (on a Saturday night!), the paramedics

at St Vincents hospital – one of only two teams ready at separate Sydney hospitals available for
unscheduled cardiac surgery emergency. (A young man in his late twenties had a
